intro: Zexmenia helianthoides, commonly known as the yellow starbursh, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as hairy leaves to reduce water loss. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Zexmenia helianthoides is often found in rocky soils and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
